title: My Journey Learning to Code
author: Hooria Mujtaba
description: A personal reflection on the challenges, breakthroughs, and lessons learned during my coding journey.
content:
# My Journey Learning to Code Looking back, what began with curiosity turned into passion. Here's my journey from zero to full-stack developer. ## Why I Started ### The Spark - Frustrated with buggy apps - Realized I wanted to build better solutions - Motivated by problem-solving, creativity, career options, and independence ## First Steps ### Starting Point: Web Development - Visual feedback - Logical skill progression ### First Code Ever: ```html

Hello, World!

``` ## Months 1–6: Learning the Basics **Tools and Resources:** - FreeCodeCamp, Codecademy - Traversy Media - CodePen, Eloquent JavaScript **Projects:** Portfolio, Calculator, To-Do App **Challenges:** 1. **Too many resources** – Solved with single-resource focus 2. **Tutorial Hell** – Rebuilt projects from scratch 3. **Imposter Syndrome** – Normalized beginner struggles ## Months 6–12: Growth Phase ### Skills Gained - React: Components, state - Node.js/Express: APIs, databases - Git, CLI, VS Code ### Breakthroughs - Mastered async JS - Built full-stack blog app - Made open-source contributions ## Roadblocks ### Debugging Nightmares - Lost 6 hours to missing JSX tag - Learned systematic bug-solving ### Framework FOMO - Stuck choosing React vs Vue - Picked React and committed ### Comparison Trap - Compared myself to pros - Learned to track personal progress instead ## Milestone Moments 1. Fixed someone else's bug 2. Async/await finally clicked 3. Built a real tool friends used 4. Received first code review ## Skillset Snapshot **Frontend:** HTML, CSS, JS, React **Backend:** Node.js, Express, MongoDB **Tools:** Git, VS Code, Chrome DevTools **Deployment:** Netlify, Vercel, Heroku **Soft Skills:** - Patience, communication - Debugging mindset - Time management ## Lessons Learned 1. Consistency > intensity 2. Build > watch 3. Community support is gold 4. Struggle = growth 5. Fundamentals first ## Where I Am Now - Full-stack ready - Contributing to open source - Mentoring beginners - Learning TypeScript and Next.js ## Advice to New Coders - Start imperfectly, improve later - Learn your style (videos, hands-on, docs) - Expect confusion and celebrate wins - Join a support network ## Tools That Helped - **Learning:** FreeCodeCamp, Odin Project, Codecademy - **Dev:** VS Code, GitHub, Chrome DevTools - **Communities:** Reddit, Discord, FreeCodeCamp Forum ## What’s Next **Short-Term:** - Master TypeScript - Build complex app - Major open-source contribution **Long-Term:** - Land dev job - Specialize (e.g. mobile dev) - Teach and share knowledge **Ongoing:** - Stay current - Attend events - Build for fun ## Final Thoughts Learning to code changed how I think and what I believe I'm capable of. It's hard, yes. But it's also deeply fulfilling. > "The best time to plant a tree was 20 years ago. The second best time is now." **Start now.** One step at a time, you'll get there. *What’s your coding journey been like? I’d love to hear it!*
